updated on April 8, 2025 Edited By Himanshu Mendiratta Planning to explore the picturesque hill stations of Rajasthan? We have brought an exclusive list for you to immerse yourself in the best hill stations of Rajasthan.Hill stations of Rajasthan are the perfect destinations to escape the extreme heat of Rajasthan. These hill stations include Mount Abu, Ranakpur, Sajjangarh, etc. However, the most popular hill station in Rajasthan is Mount Abu Hill Station. Tourists can enjoy various activities in hill stations of Rajasthan, like trekking, rock climbing, camping, etc. Also, they can visit the popular destinations in these hill stations like Nakki Lake, Ranakpur Jain Temple, etc. You can also check our Chardham Yatra by Helicopter tour package to visit the chilling mountains and have a spiritual experience. Don’t forget to check our Do Dham Yatra by Helicopter Tour , to visit Kedarnath ji and Badrinath ji.In this article, you will learn about the best hill stations for tourists in Rajasthan. Additionally, you will get the details of every hill station, like the best time to visit, the ideal duration, and how to reach each hill station.Summary Table for All Hill StationsMount AbuAchalgarhGuru ShikharParshuram MahadevRanakpurGoram GhatSajjangarh1. Mount AbuMount Abu is a beautiful hill station offering amazing scenery to tourists. This is also the perfect hill station for sightseeing and adventure activities. The scenery of Mount Abu consists of dense forests with beautiful lakes. Also, you will be able to admire the architecture of temples, havelis and forts in Mount Abu. These include the Achalgarh Fort, the Sunrise Palace, the Dilwara Temples and the Kesar Bhawan Palace. Other tourist destinations in Mount Abu include the Nakki Lake, Mount Abu Wildlife Sanctuary, Guru Shikhar Peak and Peace Park. You may try boating in Nakki Lake and camping in Mount Abu.Best Time to Visit: Between November and June.Places to Visit: Dlwara Temple, Mount Abu Wildlife Sanctuary, Nakki Lake, etc.Things to do: Boating, trekking and camping.Famous Restaurants: Four Season Restaurant, Jodhpur Bhojnalaya, Opa Restaurant, Sankalp RestaurantFamous Hotels and Resorts: Hotel Mount Regency, Hotel Oasis, Sterling Mount Abu, Hotel Silver OakIdeal duration of Trip: 1 to 2 daysHow to Reach There:By Air: Reach the Dabok Airport in Udaipur. Then, hire a taxi or a bus to reach Mount Abu.By Railways: You can travel to Abu Road railway station from cities like Jaipur, Mumbai, and Ahmedabad.By Road: Mount Abu is connected to cities like Udaipur, Jodhpur, Ahmedabad and Jaisalmer. You may use a private vehicle or a bus to travel to Mount Abu via road.2. Guru ShikharGuru Shikhar boasts the tag of the highest peak in the Aravali Ranges. Also, you will get mesmerising views of Mount Abu hill station, and Aravali ranges from the top of Guru Shikhar. Travellers can enjoy various activities like trekking and praying in temples like the Dattatreya Temple, located at the top of Guru Shikhar. The Dattatreya Temple is devoted to Guru Dattatreya, who was a well-renowned monk in the area. Other than this, Guru Shikhar Peak also has the Mount Abu Observatory.Best Time to Visit: Between October and March.Places to Visit: Dattatreya Temple, Guru Shikhar Peak.Things to do: Worship at the temple, trek to the Guru Shikhar Peak, etc.Famous Restaurants: Opa Restaurant, Mulberry Tree Restaurant, Four Season Restaurant, Jodhpur BhojanalayaFamous Hotels and Resorts: Ratan Villas Resort, Hotel Shiv Villa, Palace Hotel, MihirgarhIdeal duration of Trip: 2 to 3 hoursHow to Reach ThereBy Road: Tourists need to travel 15 Km to reach Guru Shikhar from Mount Abu by Delwara Achalgarh Road. You can cover this distance by a personal vehicle or a taxi. By Air: The nearest airport to Guru Shikhar is the Dabok Airport. After reaching Dabok Airport, you can take a bus to reach Guru Shikhar.By Railways: Abu Road Railway Station is the nearest railway station to Guru Shikhar. From Abu Railway Station, you may take a taxi to reach Guru Shikhar.3. Ranakpur Ranakpur village is a famous pilgrimage site for the Jain religion. This village is famous for its lush green places and stunning views.  Tourists can visit the famous Jain Temples of Ranakpur. These temples are devoted to famous Jain Tirthankaras, such as Adinath. Apart from this, you can try adventure activities in Ranakpur, like the jungle safari in Ranakpur. In jungle safari, you will be able to see jungle cats, wolves, jackals, sloth bears and various bird species. You may also trek to Kumbhalgarh or Aranyawas.Best Time to Visit: October to FebruaryPlaces to Visit: Ranakpur Jain Temple, Kumbhalgarh Fort, Chaumukha TempleThings to do: Sightseeing, praying in the temples, jungle safariFamous Restaurants: Pangat, Padharo Sa, La Pizzeria, Kumbhal Palace RestaurantFamous Hotels: Ranakpur Hill Resort, King’s Abode, Aranyawas, Ranakpur Safari ResortIdeal duration of Trip: 1 to 2 daysHow to Reach There:By Air: Reach the Dabok Airport in Udaipur from cities like Mumbai, Delhi, etc. From Dabok Airport, travel 68 kilometres to reach Ranakpur by taxi.By Train: Tourists may travel to Falna Railway Station. This station is well connected to major cities like Mumbai and Delhi. After reaching the Falna Station, you can hire a taxi to reach Ranakpur.By Road: You can travel to Ranakpur by bus or taxi. The best highways to travel via road are NH8 and RJ SH 16.4. Sajjangarh PalaceMaharana Sajjan Singh built Sajjangarh in 1884. This hill station is situated on the outskirts of Udaipur city on the Bansadara Peak of Aravali hills. Tourist destinations in Sajjangarh include the Sajjangarh Palace, Sajjangarh Wildlife Sanctuary and the Tiger Lake. From Sajjangarh Palace, you can get mesmerising views of the Fateh Sagar Lake. Travellers can also buy souvenirs, try Rajasthani food and explore the hilly areas around this palace.Best Time to Visit: November to FebruaryPlaces to Visit: Sajjangarh Wildlife Sanctuary, Sajjangarh Palace, Fateh Sagar LakeThings to do: Go sightseeing, enjoy boating in Fateh Sagar Lake, explore wildlife in Sajjangarh Wildlife SanctuaryFamous Restaurants: Devi Garh Restaurant, Bay Leaf Restaurant, Neel MahalFamous Hotels and Resorts: Radisson Blu Udaipur Palace Resort, Trident Udaipur, Hotel Amar Kothi, Hotel Akshay Niwas.Ideal duration of Trip: 3 to 4 hoursHow to Reach ThereBy Air: You can reach Dabok Airport in Udaipur from Ahmedabad, Jaipur, Jodhpur or Mumbai. After that, travel 27.4 kilometers via road to reach Sajjangarh Palace.By Railways: Travel to Udaipur Railway Station from Mumbai, Delhi, Jaipur, Bikaner, etc. This railway station is situated at a distance of 7.9 kilometers from Sajjangarh Palace.By Road: Travellers can take a taxi or a bus from Udaipur, Jaipur, Jodhpur, etc., to reach Sajjangarh Palace.5. Achalgarh The Achalgarh village is situated at a distance of 11 Km from Mount Abu. Popular destinations in this village are the Achalgarh Fort and the Achleshwar Temple. Rana Kumbha of Mewar constructed the Achalgarh Fort for strategic purposes. Tourists can catch a glimpse of the Manadakini Lake within the fort.  Another famous attraction is the Achleshwar Temple. This temple is devoted to Lord Shiva and has the Nandi Statue built from silver, gold, brass and copper. Other than this, travellers can enjoy trekking or camping activities in the village. Best Time to Visit: Between November and February.Places to Visit: Achleshwar Temple, Mandakini Lake, Achalgarh Fort.Things to do: Praying in the Achleshwar Temple, trekking, etc.Famous Restaurants: Sankalp Restaurant, Kailash Restaurant, Falcon The Multi Cuisine RestaurantFamous Hotels and Resorts: Hotel Shiv Villa, Hummingbird Resort, Achal Resort, Hotel AgrohaIdeal duration of Trip: 3 to 4 hoursHow to Reach ThereBy Air: Reach Dabok Airport and then take a bus/ taxi to reach Achalgarh village.By Railways: The nearest railway station to Achalgarh is Abu Road Railway Station.By Road: You can reach the main bus stand of Mount Abu, which is situated at a distance of 7 kilometer from Achalgarh.6. Parshuram MahadevParshuram Mahadev is situated in the Pali district of Rajasthan. Residents believe that Lord Parshuram (an avatar of Lord Vishnu) built the Parshuram Mahadev Temple to worship Lord Shiva. To reach this temple, you must climb the 500 stairs. After climbing the stairs, you will be greeted by magnificent views of the Aravali hills. Other places to visit near this temple are Lakhotia Garden, Jawai Dam and Om Banna Temple.Best Time to Visit: Between October and February.Places to Visit Near Parshuram Mahadev Temple: Kumbhalgarh Fort, HaldighatiThings to do: Pray in the Parshuram Mahadev Temple, enjoy the natural view of the hill stationFamous Restaurants Near Parshuram Mahadev Temple: MPS The Tea Room Rajsamand, Nogama Rajsamand, Shri Parshuram Mahadev RestaurantFamous Hotels: Mana Hotel, The Kumbha Bagh, The Kothi Heritage, Shivgarh ResortIdeal duration of Trip: 2 to 3 hoursHow to Reach ThereBy Air: Udaipur Airport is the nearest airport to Parshuram Mahadev Temple. This airport is connected to cities like Jaipur, Jodhpur, Mumbai and Kolkata. From Udaipur Airport, hire a taxi to reach Parshuram Mahadev Temple.By Road: You can reach Parshuram Mahadev from cities like Udaipur, Jaipur, Jodhpur, etc. by road.By Railways: Falna and Rani Railway Station connect Parshuram Mahadev Temple to Mumbai, Chennai, Agra, etc.7. Goram GhatGoram Ghat is situated in the Rajsamand district. This ghat offers scenic views of greenery and waterfalls. For sightseeing, you must visit the Gorakhnathji Temple in Goram Ghat. To reach this temple, you must hike 800 meters from Goram Ghat railway station. Another highlight of Goram Ghat is the Goram Ghat waterfall. Goram Ghat waterfall is a beautiful waterfall with a width of 50 ft.Additionally, tourists can trek to Bagor ki Nal Bridge and relax in the soothing environment of Goram Ghat.Best Time to Visit: Between July and September.Places to Visit: Goraknath Temple, Goram Ghat Waterfall.Things to do: Praying in the Goraknath Temple, trekking to the temple, etc.Famous Restaurants: Pitstop DeogarhFamous Hotels and Resorts: Sardargarh Heritage Hotel, Fort Seeghh Sagar, Rawla JojawarIdeal duration of Trip: 3 to 4 hoursHow to Reach: Travellers can take a train from Khamli Ghat to Goram Ghat station.ConclusionRajasthan is a magnificent state which captivates tourists with its forts, palaces, and hill stations. Among these places, the most fascinating destinations are the hill stations of Rajasthan. Hill stations like Mount Abu and Goram Ghat offer a mesmerising view of the Aravali hills. You will be able to witness the natural beauty of Rajasthan from these hill stations. Hence, you must visit the hill stations of Rajasthan on your next trip. Also, many hill stations have spectacular tourist attractions. For instance, tourists can visit the Nakki Lake, Dilwara Temples and the wildlife sanctuary in Mount Abu. Rajasthan Travel Guide will help you to explore Rajasthan.Check out our Rajasthan Tour Package for planning a trip to the wonderful hill stations in Rajasthan.Frequently Asked QuestionsQ: How many hill stations can I visit in and around Rajasthan?You can visit 15 hill stations in and around Rajasthan.Q: Which is the coldest hill station in Rajasthan?Guru Shikhar is the coldest hill station in Rajasthan.Q: What are the adventure activities to do at Rajasthan hill stations?The adventure activities to do at Rajasthan hill stations include jungle safari, camping, trekking, hot air balloon rides, etc.Q: What is the best time to visit Mount Abu?The best time to visit Mount Abu is between November and June.Q: Which are the best places to visit in Mount Abu?The best places to visit in Mount Abu are Nakki Lake, Mount Abu Wildlife Sanctuary, Toad Rock, Dilwara Temple and Mount Abu Sunset Point.Q: Which is the nearest hill station to Mount Abu?Guru Shikhar is the nearest hill station to Mount Abu. Also, Guru Shikhar boasts the title of the highest peak in the Aravali Range.Q: Which cities are the nearest to hill stations, like Ranakpur and Sajjangarh? Udaipur and Jodhpur are the nearest cities to Ranakpur and Sajjangarh hill stations.Q: Which are the most popular hill stations near Udaipur?The most popular hill stations near Udaipur are Mount Abu, Suryamal, Girnar Hill, etc.Q: Which is the best hill station for couples in Rajasthan?The best hill stations for couples are Mount Abu and Goram Ghat. In these hill stations, couples can get a beautiful view of the hills. Also, they can indulge in various activities like sightseeing, trekking, etc.Q: Which hill station should I visit with my family and friends near Rajasthan?The best hill stations near Rajasthan to visit with family and friends are Kasauli, Nainital and Auli.
